skill.name: monorepo-management
skill.description: Master monorepo management with Turborepo, Nx, and pnpm workspaces to build efficient, scalable multi-package repositories with optimized builds and dependency management. Use when setting up monorepos, optimizing builds, or managing shared dependencies.
skill.summary: Master monorepo management with Turborepo, Nx, and pnpm workspaces to build efficient, scalable mult...
skill.author: wshobson

security_audit.summary: All files contain only instructional text with example commands and configurations. No executable scripts, network calls, filesystem access, or environment access are present. This is purely educational content.

content.value_statement: Coordinating builds and dependencies across many packages is hard. This skill provides monorepo setups and practices for Turborepo, Nx, and pnpm to streamline builds and sharing.
actual_capabilities: Provide Turborepo setup steps and example turbo.json pipeline configuration
Explain pnpm workspace layout and dependency commands
Outline Nx workspace creation and affected commands
Show shared TypeScript and ESLint configuration patterns
Describe CI workflows for build, test, lint, and type checks
limitations: Does not run commands or modify repositories
Does not validate tool versions or compatibility in your repo
Does not generate project files beyond examples
Does not analyze build logs or runtime errors

use_cases.title: Unify apps and packages
use_cases.description: Plan a shared UI and config structure for multiple web apps in one repository.

use_cases.title: Speed up CI
use_cases.description: Design caching and affected builds to reduce build and test time.

use_cases.title: Standardize tooling
use_cases.description: Define shared TypeScript and ESLint presets for all packages.

prompt_templates.title: Monorepo starter
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a starter plan for a pnpm workspace with apps and packages, plus a basic turbo.json pipeline.

prompt_templates.title: Migration plan
prompt_templates.scenario: Move from multi repo to Nx
prompt_templates.prompt: Outline a migration plan to Nx with key steps, required config files, and risks to monitor.

prompt_templates.title: Cache tuning
prompt_templates.prompt: Propose cache inputs and outputs for build and test tasks to reduce run time.

prompt_templates.title: CI workflow design
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a CI workflow for lint, test, build, and type check with pnpm and Turborepo.

output_examples.input: Plan a pnpm monorepo for a web app, docs site, and shared UI package.
output: Suggested folder layout with apps and packages
Root scripts for build, test, and lint using Turborepo
Shared config package for TypeScript and ESLint
pnpm workspace entries for apps and packages

best_practices: Centralize shared configs for TypeScript, ESLint, and Prettier
Define cache inputs and outputs for each build task
Keep the dependency graph acyclic and documented
anti_patterns: Using dependencies not declared in package.json
Caching build outputs without correct inputs

faq.question: Is this compatible with Turborepo and Nx?
faq.answer: Yes. It provides setup and workflows for both tools with pnpm workspaces.

faq.question: What are the limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance and examples only and does not execute commands or edit files.

faq.question: Can it integrate with existing CI?
faq.answer: Yes. It outlines GitHub Actions steps that you can adapt to your pipeline.

faq.question: Does it access my data or credentials?
faq.answer: No. It contains instructional content only and does not read files or secrets.

faq.question: What if my builds are still slow?
faq.answer: Review cache inputs and outputs and use affected builds to limit scope.

faq.question: How does it compare to generic monorepo advice?
faq.answer: It is tool specific with Turborepo, Nx, and pnpm focused examples.
